overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a comprehensive approach to time-series forecasting with hourly data, emphasizing the identification of daily seasonality and adaptation to data constraints. The analyst systematically evaluates multiple methods (SARIMA, exponential smoothing, averaging) before selecting a simple averaging technique due to limited data size (96 points) and absence of strong trends. The reasoning includes data validation, pattern analysis, method comparison, and implementation details, reflecting strong domain knowledge balanced with practical simplicity.
common_data_patterns: Consistent hourly fluctuations (high at night, low/negative daytime)
Complete data without missing values (noted as potential concern)
Minimal trend presence over short horizon
key_insights: Prioritizing simplicity (hourly averaging) over complex models (SARIMA/ETS) when data is limited
Explicit handling of decimal precision to match input data format
Grouping by hour for seasonal pattern extraction
Date-time handling for forecast period generation
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with multi-step evaluation: Starts with advanced model consideration (SARIMA/ETS), transitions to heuristic-based averaging after assessing data limitations, and includes detailed implementation logic for data processing and forecasting.
